show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
Security Update: NPM QIX attack

1. If you're using the Farcaster app on web or mobile, you are safe. 

2. If you're using a Farcaster miniapp, be cautious unless the developer has confirmed it's safe. Reject any transactions from miniapps you don‚Äôt fully understand.

What happened? 

An attacker took over an NPM developer's account and replaced packages with malicious versions. These low-level, open-source components are used by many apps, including popular crypto wallets. Any app that updates these packages today may load the malicious code, which can propose dangerous transactions to users.

The Farcaster app uses some of these packages, but we have confirmed we haven‚Äôt updated them since the attack. It's therefore safe to use our app. 

Farcaster miniapps could have been affected. If a miniapp is impacted, it may propose a dangerous transaction. Our security scanning should catch most of these, and even if something slips through, you‚Äôll see a transaction preview to review and reject. If you‚Äôre using a miniapp, it‚Äôs important to read the details and accept only transactions you understand.

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
summary of today's NPM compromise, vulnerable package versions, and action items for devs here, from @andrewmohawk at Privy.

if your app uses NPM (includes mini apps), please check your dependencies.

https://x.com/AndrewMohawk/status/1965116722375209305
https://x.com/AndrewMohawk/status/1965117607750881561

oembed.html:
Lot of chatter about the QIX NPM compromise. TL;DR
-- Dev was compromised ~9am ET ( https://t.co/bgOwN57xyz )
-- Malicious packages removed at ~11.30 ET ( https://t.co/XApcXgcQoK )
If you installed in this time please check your codebase.

— AndrewMohawk‚ÅΩ‚Åø·µòÀ°À°‚Åæ (@AndrewMohawk) September 8, 2025

This would only impact you if:
- FRESH install between ~9am and ~11.30am ET
- OR Package-lock.json created in that time
- Vuln packages in direct or transient dependencies

— AndrewMohawk‚ÅΩ‚Åø·µòÀ°À°‚Åæ (@AndrewMohawk) September 8, 2025

Mini apps can now request users to sign domain ownership. This unlocks V0/Lovable for Farcaster: AI platforms that let you vibe code mini apps and host them FOR you while keeping ownership tied to YOUR account

What this means:
- Create your mini app with prompting, platform hosts while you own
- You get the developer rewards
- You're recognized as the creator

Time to update the Base app. Here's what's new in our latest update:
üîπ Browse an improved feed with more posts from the people you follow (and posts you can buy)

üîπFind coins you‚Äôve created easier than ever with better asset logos
üîπ‚Ä¶And tons of performance gains across the app with fixes to deep links, permissions, and pre-fetching

Tell us what you want next.

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
Sure, happy to address this absolute mess. 

I announced a CTO of Circus a few weeks back. We handed over the project to a team we had worked with for a couple of months who successfully closed deals with some KOLs, managed launches, community engagement, etc. 

I met with their dev, who also came across as a reasonably knowledgeable guy. 

These were people we spoke to on a daily basis via either Telegram or voice. 

We didn‚Äôt have any reason to consider this team untrustworthy. If anything they were eager to make the project succeed. 

A CTO is just that, a take over. The deal was that we would provide them with the LP tokens and would keep paying for the infra while we transitioned the code to their team. 

In return, they would keep the project going, grow it, and give it new life where we couldn‚Äôt. 

They continually dragged the launch date out further and further but kept us in the loop constantly. We were even going to help them with some of the configurations for the launch. With the intention to use the Circus Launchpad. 

The other night, the lead guy started threatening me. Trying to squeeze me for money. He sent me pics of my family and made several threats I would consider severe. 

The following day, he apologized for ‚Äúcrashing out‚Äù and went on to continue planning the launch, which was meant to be this week. 

At approximately 23:30 CEST I start getting messages about a rug that occurred and tweets from the Circus social accounts, which we had turned over weeks ago. 

Probably the worst possible outcome imaginable and I am still getting all the facts myself. Very frustrating, especially when I‚Äôm not at my desk and able to handle things appropriately.

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
ripping friction out of tipping

use ripper to retroactively tip who you interacted with on Farcastee in the past X days

https://ripper.onchain.cooking

cast.text:
Yes, tipping has added unwanted friction. The problem is all these services are unbound, there is no spending limit.

I think tipping should not be real-time. I want to be able to set the amount I want to spend (per day? per week?) and have the tipping services distribute the fixed amount to all my reactions in this period.

For example, I want to spend $10/week: Group all the events that trigger tips throughout the week, and distribute my $10 accordingly. 

Aggregating this activity, opens the door to additional features. For example, new distribution rules, like "no more than 30% to a single recipient" (just because we engaged in an endless thread), "favor new users", "ignore specific users" (automation bots), etc. 

ht/t to @nounishprof and @adrienne for bringing the topic up in GMFarcaster #284.

https://farcaster.xyz/7858.eth/0x6f552190

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
During class tonight, we launched the Extra Credit $xtra token which I'll be using during the rest of the semester as a way to demonstrate some tokenomics and allow for them to see a token from creation on. This was done as part of a lecture on tokenomics and review of clanker as a lead up to a tokenomics project they have. (they will develop a concept for their own token). I'll be using this as a reward for students during the class. 

We did do a 30% 30 day lockup. Most of this will be burned with some distributed to holders. In terms of what else we'll be doing with this token, I'll keep you posted. But this primarily will be used as a teaching tool and fees will cover funds I send to the students. (I've already given them .005 eth each plus some usdc to use during the class for various assignments).

I'll also be incorporating this token into Noice for tipping of students who interact on Farcaster. Just giving everyone a heads up on the plans for this token.

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text:
I‚Äôm joining the CityKids Foundation as part-time Director of Emerging Tech & Digital Programs.

I‚Äôve loved advising this team for years, and now I‚Äôll help lead the strategy for a vision that belongs onchain: CityKids Speak on Liberty , Keith Haring‚Äôs largest work, created with 1,000 kids in the 80s.

90 feet tall. A living, breathing work of Artivism. Known as the people‚Äôs masterpiece, it has toured the U.S. and once stood behind Paul McCartney at the Super Bowl.

We‚Äôve recently uncovered a vault of never-before-seen footage of Keith and the kids creating the banner, now being developed into a documentary for the 2026 festival circuit.

I‚Äôm beginning conversations with marketplaces, chains, funders, partners, and auction houses. Let‚Äôs chat!

show_title: From Nounish Sails to Choo-Choo Trains: GM Farcaster ep288 with guest cohost Rachel Wilkins
text: Kicking off something new at Good News Studio. Each week, we'll share a thought piece inspired by conversations from our podcast, The Good News Is...diving into culture, tech, and consciousness. First up: the future of health + why ancient wisdom still matters. Full read üëá

cast.text: In a rapidly changing world, advanced technologies in medicine may improve diagnostic capabilities, yet they cannot address the underlying lifestyle choices that profoundly influence health. @rachelw's latest blog emphasizes the need for a holistic approach that prioritizes sleep, nutrition, and emotional wellbeing alongside technological advancements. Highlighting insights from expert Luke Coutinho, the blog navigates toward a future where individual agency and mindful living reframe our collective approach to health and wellness.

ogImage.alt: The Future of Health: Modern Science Meets Ancient Wisdom

html.ogTitle: The Future of Health: Modern Science Meets Ancient Wisdom
html.ogDescription: We are living in an age of acceleration. Artificial intelligence, biotechnology, and advanced diagnostics are transforming our understanding of the human body at a pace that would have seemed unimaginable just a decade ago. Within five years, experts predict, our approach to disease will look radically different. Already, continuous glucose monitors, genome sequencing, and AI-driven imaging tools are enabling us to detect disease earlier and intervene more precisely. But technology alone cann...

text: Every year, the first glimpse of the 9/11 remembrance lights stops me in my tracks. A powerful reminder etched into the sky spotted tonight on my walk home from yoga class.
